intro: Centrosolenia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy centrosolenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
